com.bigdata.btree

Class TestBTreeWithBloomFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • junit.framework.TestCase2
          • com.bigdata.btree.AbstractBTreeTestCase
            • com.bigdata.btree.TestBTreeWithBloomFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class TestBTreeWithBloomFilter
extends AbstractBTreeTestCase
    Unit tests for a BTree with its bloom filter enabled. This class is mostly focused on the basic bloom filter mechanics. Also see TestIndexSegmentWithBloomFilter which was originally written to test the IndexSegment behavior with a bloom filter, but which also tests the BTree to some extent now that the BTree also maintains a bloom filter.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BTree getBTree(int branchingFactor, boolean bloomFilter)
      Return a btree backed by a journal with the indicated branching factor.
      void test_add_contains()
      Simple test to verify that the bloom filter does not break the semantics of insert, lookup, contains, or remove.
      void test_autoDisable()
      Unit test verifies that the bloom filter is automatically disabled once the #of entries in the BTree exceeds the maxN (the calculated #of index entries at which the bloom filter performance will have degraded to below the desired maximum error rate).
      void test_create() 
      void test_disable()
      Unit test disables the bloom filter and verifies that a checkpoint writes a 0L as the address of the bloom filter and that on reload the btree does not have a bloomfilter
      void test_persistence_bloomFilterDiscarded()
      Simple test that the bloom filter is discarded if the btree is closed without writing a checkpoint.
      void test_persistence()
      Simple test that the bloom filter is persisted with the btree and reloaded from the store.
      void test_removeAll()
      Verifies that BTree.removeAll() resets the bloom filter.

    • Method Detail

      • getBTree

        public BTree getBTree(int branchingFactor,
             boolean bloomFilter)
        Return a btree backed by a journal with the indicated branching factor. The serializer requires that values in leaves are SimpleEntry objects.
        Parameters:
        branchingFactor - The branching factor.
        Returns:
        The btree.

      • test_create

        public void test_create()

      • test_add_contains

        public void test_add_contains()
        Simple test to verify that the bloom filter does not break the semantics of insert, lookup, contains, or remove.

      • test_persistence

        public void test_persistence()
        Simple test that the bloom filter is persisted with the btree and reloaded from the store.
        See Also:
        BloomFilter, AbstractBTree.bloomFilter, AbstractBTree#usesBloomFilter

      • test_persistence_bloomFilterDiscarded

        public void test_persistence_bloomFilterDiscarded()
        Simple test that the bloom filter is discarded if the btree is closed without writing a checkpoint.

      • test_removeAll

        public void test_removeAll()
        Verifies that BTree.removeAll() resets the bloom filter.

      • test_disable

        public void test_disable()
        Unit test disables the bloom filter and verifies that a checkpoint writes a 0L as the address of the bloom filter and that on reload the btree does not have a bloomfilter

      • test_autoDisable

        public void test_autoDisable()
        Unit test verifies that the bloom filter is automatically disabled once the #of entries in the BTree exceeds the maxN (the calculated #of index entries at which the bloom filter performance will have degraded to below the desired maximum error rate).
